metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3423 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
lisp/net/browse-url.el in GNU Emacs 24.3 and earlier allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a /tmp/Mosaic.##### temporary file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs24 - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
emacs24-bin-common - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
emacs24-common - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
emacs24-el - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
emacs24-lucid - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
emacs24-nox - 24.5+1-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Mosiac hard-coded this pid file name, the alternative is dropping support for Mosiac entirely. Don't be hasty. leosilva> from emacs, they added this line only http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/emacs-diffs/2014-05/msg00057.html not-fixed

criterions.comment: emacs24 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '24.5+1-6ubuntu1').
